intro: Aulonemia clarkiae, commonly known as Clark's spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soils, forming dense clusters with slender, erect stems. Its inflorescence consists of a single spike of small, three-sided flowers, which are wind-pollinated. Aulonemia clarkiae plays a role in stabilizing wetland habitats and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
